## üöÄ Quick Actions

### I want to...

#### Create a new FSD (Functional Specification Document)
1. Copy [FSD-Template.md](./FSD-Template.md)
2. Save to `/docs/specifications/FSD-[YourFeature].md`
3. Fill in all sections

#### Create a new TSD (Technical Specification Document)
1. Copy [TSD-Template.md](./TSD-Template.md)
2. Save to `/docs/specifications/TSD-[YourComponent].md`
3. Fill in all sections

#### Learn about documentation standards
- Read [DOCUMENTATION_STANDARDS.md](./DOCUMENTATION_STANDARDS.md)

#### Get a quick overview
- Read [README.md](./README.md)

#### See detailed examples
- Read [TEMPLATES_README.md](./TEMPLATES_README.md)

#### Understand what was implemented
- Read [IMPLEMENTATION_SUMMARY.md](./IMPLEMENTATION_SUMMARY.md)

## üìÅ File Descriptions

### FSD-Template.md
**Functional Specification Document Template**
- 9 main sections
- Covers business requirements
- Includes user personas and use cases
- Defines acceptance criteria

### TSD-Template.md
**Technical Specification Document Template**
- 12 main sections
- Covers technical implementation
- Includes API endpoints and database design
- Defines architecture and integrations

### DOCUMENTATION_STANDARDS.md
**Complete Documentation Standards Guide**
- Full template content
- Usage guidelines
- Best practices
- Examples and scenarios

### README.md
**Quick Start Guide**
- Overview of templates
- Quick start instructions
- When to use each template
- Best practices summary

### TEMPLATES_README.md
**Detailed Quick Reference**
- Comprehensive guide
- File naming conventions
- Directory structure
- Example workflows

### IMPLEMENTATION_SUMMARY.md
**Implementation Summary**
- What was delivered
- Requirements verification
- File structure
- Usage instructions

## üéØ By Role

### For Developers
- Use [TSD-Template.md](./TSD-Template.md) for technical docs
- Reference [DOCUMENTATION_STANDARDS.md](./DOCUMENTATION_STANDARDS.md) for API documentation

### For Product Managers
- Use [FSD-Template.md](./FSD-Template.md) for feature specs
- Reference [TEMPLATES_README.md](./TEMPLATES_README.md) for workflows

### For Team Leads
- Review [IMPLEMENTATION_SUMMARY.md](./IMPLEMENTATION_SUMMARY.md) for overview
- Share [README.md](./README.md) with team

### For New Team Members
- Start with [README.md](./README.md)
- Review [TEMPLATES_README.md](./TEMPLATES_README.md)
- Practice with templates

## üìä Template Comparison

| Aspect | FSD | TSD |
|--------|-----|-----|
| **Focus** | Business requirements | Technical implementation |
| **Audience** | Product, Business | Developers, Architects |
| **Sections** | 9 main sections | 12 main sections |
| **Content** | User-facing features | System architecture |
| **Examples** | Use cases, workflows | API endpoints, schemas |

## üîó External Resources

### Creating Documentation
```bash
# Create FSD
cp .github/FSD-Template.md docs/specifications/FSD-YourFeature.md

# Create TSD
cp .github/TSD-Template.md docs/specifications/TSD-YourComponent.md
```

## ‚úÖ Checklist for Creating Documentation

### Before You Start
- [ ] Determine if you need FSD or TSD (or both)
- [ ] Review the appropriate template
- [ ] Understand the required sections

### While Creating
- [ ] Copy the template to correct location
- [ ] Rename following naming convention
- [ ] Fill in all sections
- [ ] Replace all placeholders
- [ ] Include code references
- [ ] Add diagrams if needed

### Before Submitting
- [ ] Review all sections for completeness
- [ ] Check for placeholder text
- [ ] Verify code references are correct
- [ ] Update status field
- [ ] Add to revision history
- [ ] Get peer review

### After Approval
- [ ] Mark status as "Approved"
- [ ] Share with team
- [ ] Update as implementation progresses
- [ ] Mark as "Implemented" when complete

## üéì Learning Path

### Beginner
1. Read [README.md](./README.md)
2. Review [FSD-Template.md](./FSD-Template.md)
3. Review [TSD-Template.md](./TSD-Template.md)

1. Read [TEMPLATES_README.md](./TEMPLATES_README.md)
2. Practice creating a document
3. Review best practices

### Advanced
1. Read [DOCUMENTATION_STANDARDS.md](./DOCUMENTATION_STANDARDS.md)
2. Understand all sections in depth
3. Create comprehensive documentation
